question: Which two water bodies form the coastline of Djibouti?
option2: Persian Gulf and Gulf of Oman
option3: Red Sea and Gulf of Aden
option4: Gulf of Suez and Gulf of Aden
answer: Red Sea and Gulf of Aden
explanation: Djibouti is a country located in the Horn of Africa and Bab-el-Mandeb of East Africa at the southern entrance to the Red Sea at the northernmost point of the Great Rift Valley. It is bordered by Eritrea to the north; Ethiopia to the south and west; Somalia to the south. The Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden form the coastline of Djibouti to the east. The capital of Djibouti is Djibouti City.
